comments.body: do we expect the focus to remain where it had been when you have two text fields in two different tabs and you switch from one tab, then switch to the other tab? that might be something worth testing here too
Shouldn't be possible. The iOS convention is to hide the tabs when the keyboard is present. It's not possible to change tabs when a field has focus.
it's definitely possible in flutter though, right?

Seems like on Android the focus isn't lost when dismissing the keyboard to reveal the tab bar. 

The described scenario works. Added a test.

I think it would be helpful to add some comments that elaborate on what these verifications really mean.  For example, maybe something like:

```dart
// Verify that Page 2 is the only page that exists because Tab 2 should be selected.
```
Add a test for trying to go to tab 20 when there are 4 tabs.

Should include a test where two tab scaffolds share the same controller. Both scaffolds should reflect programmatic changes to the controller. Rebuilding with just one tab scaffold shouldn't affect the controller and subsequent controller changes shouldn't fail because the old listeners (the ones that belonged to the second scaffold) were correctly removed.
Thanks for testing the controller swap too!  That logic was a bit complicated.
